sentences.en: Can not blow away the sanguine red on my face.
sentences.cn: 也不能吹去我面血的绯红.

sentences.en: He has a sanguine attitude to life.
sentences.cn: 他对于人生有乐观的看法.

sentences.en: He seemed quite sanguine about his chances of success.
sentences.cn: 他看上去对成功的可能性十分乐观.

sentences.en: He was always so ready to be interested and always so happy, sanguine and light - hearted.
sentences.cn: 他总是那么体贴,那么愉快 、 那么乐观、那么无忧无虑.

sentences.en: He's remarkably sanguine about the problems involved.
sentences.cn: 他对所涉及的问题态度极为乐观。

sentences.en: His hair was very fair, his face naturally sanguine.
sentences.cn: 他的头发很淡, 脸色天生红润.

sentences.en: His private expectations were not so sanguine.
sentences.cn: 他私下的期望并不是那么乐观.

sentences.en: Many of the Chinese working in Zambia are sanguine about the criticism.
sentences.cn: 许多在赞比亚工作的中国人面对这些批评指责的时候,都很愤怒.

sentences.en: Murray or sanguine - Not hasty in battle, and yet a victor.
sentences.cn: 血红色 - 象征在战场上向来应对谨慎, 却依然总受到胜利之神眷顾的人.

sentences.en: President Roosevelt's estimate of the final collapse was, in my opinion, too sanguine by many weeks.
sentences.cn: 依我看, 罗斯福总统似乎过于自信,他估计崩溃仅为时数星期之久.

sentences.en: The sanguine — and conventional — argument is that none of it matters much.
sentences.cn: 乐观派----以及保守派----的观点是这些都并不重要.

sentences.en: They are less sanguine about the company's long-term prospects.
sentences.cn: 他们对公司的远景不那么乐观。

sentences.en: They have begun to take a more sanguine view.
sentences.cn: 他们的看法已经开始变得乐观起来。

sentences.en: They were sanguine about [ of ] victory.
sentences.cn: 他们对胜利表示乐观 [ 确信会胜利 ] (参看1c).

sentences.en: They were sanguine that they would win.
sentences.cn: 他们确信自己会赢(参看1b).

words.tran_cn: 血的；血红色的；多血质的；乐观的

trans.tran_cn: 乐观的，充满希望的，面色红润的，血红色的
trans.tran_en: happy and hopeful about the future
